intro: Cwangayana scandens, commonly known as the climbing orchid, is a tropical plant native to regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its攀援 growth habit and striking, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically has elongated, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, often colorful blooms that attract pollinators. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
